data.name: The Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, The Universe, and Everything
data.description:
# Story The number 42 is, in *The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy* by Douglas Adams, the "Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything", calculated by an enormous supercomputer named Deep Thought over a period of 7.5 million years. # Task Make an array of depth 42. At the deepest level, one should find the number 42. This should look like this: ```[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[42]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]``` # Limitations
  • You may only write one line of code
  • Your function ```fortyTwo``` should contain 42 characters or less
  • Your function ```fortyTwo``` should contain a comment ```/*42*/```
  • You are not allowed to use brackets ```{}```, commas ```,``` and semicolons ```;```
  • You are not allowed to used numbers ```0123456789```, except for the comment ```/*42*/```
